data.title: Mitt Romney Bio, Parents, Children, Siblings, Net Worth
data.meta_description: Mitt Romney Bio, Parents, Children, Siblings, Net Worth: Mitt Romney, officially known as Willard Mitt Romney is an American politician, businessman, and lawyer. As a member of the Republican Party, he served as the 70th governor of Massachusetts from 2003 to 2007.
data.text:
Mitt Romney Bio, Parents, Children, Siblings, Net Worth: Mitt Romney, officially known as Willard Mitt Romney is an American politician, businessman, and lawyer.

As a member of the Republican Party, he served as the 70th governor of Massachusetts from 2003 to 2007.

Mitt Romney was the Republican Partyâs nominee for president of the United States in the 2012 election, losing to Barack Obama.

He has been serving as the junior United States senator from Utah since January 2019, succeeding Orrin Hatch.

READ ALSO: Mitt Romney Net Worth, Age, Height

In February 2023, he made major headlines when he referred to George Santos as an âa sick puppyâ stating that, he had no place in Congress in a heated exchange at the State of the Union event.

The encounter took place ahead of President Joe Bidenâs speech on Tuesday, February 7, 2023, as Mr. Santos shook hands with people near Mr. Romneyâs seat.

Mr. Romney later told reporters that he believed Mr. Santos âshould be sitting in the back rowâ.

This comes after a few months when Mr. Santos reportedly admitted to fabricating large parts of his CV and biography and has faced calls to resign.

After the address at the State of the Union event, Mr. Romney told reporters that Mr. Santos âshouldnât be in Congressâ.

âI didnât expect him to be standing there trying to shake hands with every senator and the president of the United States,â Mr. Romney said.

âGiven the fact that heâs under an ethics investigation, he should be sitting in the back row and staying quiet instead of parading in front of the president and the people coming into the room,â

Adding that, if Mr. Santos âhad any shame at all, he wouldnât be thereâ.

Mitt Romney Age

Mitt Romney celebrated his 75th birthday on March 12, 2022. He was born on March 12, 1947, at the Harper University Hospital in Detroit, Michigan, United States. Mitt will be 76 in March this year.

Mitt Romney Height

Mitt Romney stands at a height of 1.87 m

Mitt Romney Parents

Mitt Romney was born at the Harper University Hospital in Detroit, Michigan, United States to George W. Romney (father) and Lenore Romney (mother).

His father was an automobile executive while his mother is a former actress and homemaker.

His father was born to American parents in a Mormon colony in Chihuahua, Mexico and his mother was a native of Logan, Utah.

Mitt Romney Wife

Mitt Romney is a happily married man. He has been married to Ann Romney since 1969. The pair tied the knot in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan, United States.

Ann Romney, officially Ann Lois Romney is an American author and philanthropist. She was the first Lady of Massachusetts, while her husband served as governor from 2003 to 2007.

Mitt Romney Children

Mitt Romney has been blessed with five children; Tagg Romney, Ben Romney, Matt Romney, Craig Romney, and Josh Romney. Mitt shares five children with his wife, Ann Romney.

Mitt Romney Siblings

Mitt Romney was born as one of four children to his parents, George W. Romney (father) and Lenore Romney (mother).

Mitt grew up with three other siblings (a brother and 2 sisters); George Scott Romney, Jane Romney, and Margo Lynn Romney.

George is an American Republican politician and lawyer in the state of Michigan. He formerly sat on the Michigan State University Board of Trustees.
